alert.note: Alert for Cabarrus (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 08 at 1:43PM EDT until April 13 at 3:24PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following county, Cabarrus. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 136 PM EDT, An automated stream gauge on the Rocky River above Irish Buffalo Creek indicated the river was running near bankfull. Doppler radar indicated light to moderate rainfall continuing over Cabarrus County. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen in the past 24 hours. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. Streams and creeks are expected to continue to slowly rise through the afternoon into the evening, and many streams may rise to near bankfull, with some minor flooding of low water crossings possible. Otherwise, nuisance flooding of ditches, low spots, and other locations with poor drainage can be expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Concord, Harrisburg, and Mt Pleasant. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
